Description: Body sherd of large North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery krater with handle root; white slip; interior: glazed at top with part of added red band lined in white; lower part reserved; exterior: to left, black at handle root; in panel to right, large black palmette with volutes (added red on alternating petals) preserved of floral cross; dots and dashes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.479)
